div.l: With shetes and with chalons faire y spredde
Nouȝt from his owne bed ten fote or twelue
His doughter hadde a bed ab by hire selue
Right in þe same chambre by and by
It mighte be no bette and cause whi
¶ Ther was no Romer herberwe in þe place
Þei soupen and þei speken hem to solace
And drynken euer͗e strong ale atte beste
Abowte mydde nyght wente þei to reste
Wel hath þis Mellere vernesshed his hed
Ful pale he was for dronken ⁊and nouȝt red
He yexeth and he spekeþ þourgh þe nose
As he ware on the quakke or on þe pose
To bedde he goth and with him goþ his wif
As any Iay he light was and Iolyf
So was hire Ioly whistel wel y wette
The cradell at hire beddes fete is y sette
To rokken and to yeue þe child to souke
And whan þat dronken was al in þe crouke
To bedde went þe dougther right anoon
To bedde goþ aleyn and also Iohn
Ther nas nomore þem nedede no dwale
Þis Mellere hath so wisly bibbed ale
Þat as an hors h snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taylle be hynde he toke no kepe
His wif bar him a bourdoıı̄un a ful strong
Men mighten here Routyng her on a furlong

Alayn þe clerk þat herde þis melodie
He powkede Iohn and seide slepest þow
Herdest þow euere slik a sang or now
Loo swilk a complyng is be twixe hem alle
A wilde fir on þayr͗e bodies falle
Ho herknede eủere swilk a ferly þing
Ye þei sall haue þe flour of ille ending
This lang night þer tides me na reste Correction mark "X" in left margin, but no correction is evident.
But yet na force al shal be for þe beste
For Iohn seide he as eủere mote I þryue
Yf þat I may yon wenche wil I swyue
Som esement has law shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a law þat seith þus
